intro: Tetracera grandis, commonly known as the large tetracera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gentianaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Tetracera grandis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
